title.rendered: Welly User Group: Community Cloud Expert

content.rendered:
Welly User Group: Be a Community Cloud Expert
June 24, 2020


Overview

Salesforce User Group, Wellington, New Zealand

What a User Group they are, so welcoming, so amazing, so helpful, so curious, I truly loved participating with this group over COVID while in lockdown so far.Their page starts “We welcome anyone with a connection to or interest in the Salesforce platform to our meetings. This includes ALL customers (government, commercial, non-profit, small business), Salesforce staff, interested parties, prospective customers, students, as well as Salesforce implementation / app partners,…we welcome the world to dial in to see what’s happening in our amazing little capital city! Once we are able to return to in-person meetings, regular monthly virtual meetings will also continue to be offered, so check back here often!”As a guest and virtual member I have felt welcome here. CHECK THIS GROUP OUT!! You will not be disappointed!!

The admin group works closely with the DUG, AND they run the unsponsored SalesforceSaturday & Trailhead Tuesday #BOOM! What a giving group! 

Info on Trailhead Tuesday and a Salesforce Saturday


Group Leader: Anna Loughan


Twitter



Chatter Group


Chatter



Group Twitter


Follow them Here

Event Sumary

Community Cloud expert and Salesforce MVP, Meighan Brodkey, has agreed to share some of her community knowledge with the Wellington Salesforce Ohana.If you have Community Cloud and you are struggling with sharing settings, privacy and security setup, don’t look any further. Join Community Cloud expert Meighan Brodkey and learn how to set Community Cloud from scratch or how to perform security audit and adjust the existing settings. Join us to learn how to setup your sharing via sharing sets, account relationships, channel programs, groups, Apex sharing, profiles, and Licenses. You will understand better how the types of sharing work together, how to decide when to use each, and best practices for implementation of a secure Community. Meighan will also suggest apps to help you check guest perms, monitor, and maintain your user access to keep things running smoothly and your data safe and sound.This meeting may run for more than 60 minutes!Meighan was planning to present a similar session at Kiwi Dreaming, which would have been in May. She is still very keen to visit New Zealand once that becomes possible – she lives in Seattle.This meeting will be run virtually even though we are no longer in lockdown in New Zealand! All of our extended Salesforce Ohana worldwide are welcome to attend this meeting, but please only register if you genuinely plan to attend, to allow as many as possible to attend!

Deck

excerpt.rendered:
Join me to talk Community Cloud security from scratch or audit your existing. We’ll review how to setup sharing sets, account relationships, channel programs, Apex sharing, profiles, and licenses. Better how the types of sharing work together, how to decide when to use each, and best practices for implementing a secure Community. I’ll even share some awesome apps to help you check guest perms, monitor, and maintain your user access to keep things running smoothly and your data safe and sound.

Session Link

Cinco De Mayo for Salesforce YYC!!
Join the Calgary User Group and me to learn about Community Cloud use cases for Partner, Customer, and unauthenticated Communities.we’ll dive into the different ways you can use Communities from submitting Leads and Opportunities, Self Service help portals, sharing content and more! Learn about how others use Community Cloud to connect, build their brand and better relationships; inspiring you to see the infinite possibilities for you and your Community.
